title: Sen. Patrick Leahy Says He Won’t Run for Re-Election in 2022
sub_head: The Vermont Democrat has served in the Senate for decades; ‘time to put down the gavel’
body:
WASHINGTON—Sen. Patrick Leahy (D., Vt.), the longest-serving lawmaker in the Senate and the chairman of the Appropriations Committee, on Monday said that he won’t run for re-election next year.
“It is time to put down the gavel,” Mr. Leahy said. “It is time to pass the torch to the next Vermonter who will carry on this work for our great state. It is time to come home.”
